1610350298_1yhTF4WKRZsCBdVeh8fwPj14zAiEd.body:
Recommend for normal use:
1. Fedora
2. Arch
3. Debian

BSD are cool but not really all that worth using for most people, anything that uses snaps is a no.

If your primary goal is learning, starting with Arch and going to Gentoo (selinux hardened) is a decent idea. Especially if you want to learn about MAC controls, how kernels decrypt encrypted root volumes, and maybe how to encrypt user folders.
